tool_description:
LIVE, IN-GAME, REAL TIME, statistics.  
WITH BETTING / GAMBLING ODDS
NHL (National Hockey League)

Game schedules, game times, and rosters are updated every hour as well.

Includes player news, fantasy news, and top headlines, all updated multiple times an hour.

Perfect to support your fantasy site or any application that needs NHL data in real time.
name: Tank01 NHL Live In-Game Real Time Statistics NHL
title: Tank01 NHL Live In-Game Real Time Statistics NHL
tool_name: Tank01 NHL Live In-Game Real Time Statistics NHL

api_list.name: Get Player Information
api_list.description:
Call this to get general information on each player (name, team, experience, birthday, college, image link, etc).

This can accept either "playerID" or "playerName".    

If you use playerID then the body will return one object.  playerID values can be found from performing a get on the team roster API. playerID is the unique identifier for each player, and is the preferred parameter to use in this call.

If you use playerName then it will return a list of objects, since many players can have the same name.  It acts as more of a search/scan than direct access, and will be a slower call than if you use playerID.

Also, you don't have to call the full name with playerName.  You can use partial name.  For example, if you call with only playerName=smith then it will return all players with smith in their full name.

getStats=true will bring back current season stats for the returned players

optional_parameters.name: playerName
optional_parameters.description: Name to search by.  Can be partial name

api_list.name: Get Stats Projections
api_list.description:
This will retrieve stats projections, regular season only, for 7 days ahead, 14 days ahead, or rest of the regular season.

Goalies will have a different set of projections than other players.  To help you filter on the results, if the player is a goalie, then he'll have an element "goalie"=="True".  If not, then "goalie"=="False".

/getNHLProjections.
projectionType element is required.
options are "season", "7", or "14".

/getNHLProjections?projectionType=season
/getNHLProjections?projectionType=7
/getNHLProjections?projectionType=14

api_list.name: Get NHL Games and Stats For a Single Player
api_list.description:
This call will grab a map of all of the games a player has played this season.   
playerID is a required parameter.
You can also use gameID if you want to only pull back a specific game. 

season is an optional parameter.  Currently only 2024 (this season) is available.  If you do not include season as a parameter, it will return this season's games. 


You can limit the amount of games returned with parameter: numberOfGames.   For example: &numberOfGames=5 will return the last 5 games this player has an entry for.

Example:
Correct way to get the stats for Connor Bedard for the season opener against PIT on 10/10/2023, would be this:
/getNHLGamesForPlayer?playerID=5149125&gameID=20231010_CHI@PIT

But if you wanted to get all of his games this season, you'd make this call
/getMLBGamesForPlayer?playerID=5149125

This call will not work without playerID.  If you want stats for all players during a game, then use the getNHLBoxScore call with that specific gameID.

api_list.name: Get Team Schedule
api_list.description:
This endpoint returns the full season schedule for any NHL team identified in the parameters.

Example:

/getNHLTeamSchedule?teamID=7
or
/getNHLTeamSchedule?teamAbv=CHI

Calling it either way will return the same result, a list of the Blackhawks games this season, each game in it's own map.  If the game has been played or started, the linescore and game result will be included in the game's map.

api_list.name: Get Teams
api_list.description:
This endpoint provides you with all teams, their cities, names, abbreviations, and some other general information.  This endpoint isn't necessary to call very often, as the data here won't change much throughout the season.  Perhaps make a point to call it once a week, as we will most likely be adding information to it every once in a while.

This does not need parameters. It just returns the same full list every time. 

Optional parameters are... 

topPerformers=true 
This will return the best player for each statistical category on each team.

teamStats=true

This will return team level/season long stats for each team

api_list.name: Get NHL Betting Odds
api_list.description:
This grabs NHL betting/gambling lines and odds from some of the most popular online sportsbooks (fanduel, betrivers, betmgm, caesars, pointsbet, etc). 

You can call this for specific game or a specific date.  Check out the example responses here for the type of data you can expect back.   Some of the sportsbooks do not offer live betting, so data from those sportsbooks will not be returned after the game starts.  

Historical Odds go back as far as date 20240208.

Either gameDate or gameID is required.
Examples of what the calls can look like:
/getNHLBettingLines?gameDate=20240208
/getNHLBettingLines?gameID=20240208_CGY@NJ

optional_parameters.name: gameID
optional_parameters.description: gameID as can be found in many of the endpoints here

api_list.name: Get Team Roster
api_list.description:
This call returns the current or historical* roster of any team, using the teamID (or teamAbv) that can be found in "getNHLTeams" call.

Rosters are updated hourly during the day.

Historical rosters are saved on a daily basis as of (not sure) and moving forward. 
 
Here are examples of the two ways to call and get the Blackhawks roster:
/getNHLTeamRoster?teamID=7
or
/getNHLTeamRoster?teamAbv=CHI

add getStats=true to get player stats.  

Add parameter archiveDate to the call to get a list of roster players (playerID's only) for that specific date.  Historical roster dates only are kept as far back as WHAT DATE?

getStats does not work with the historical Roster

optional_parameters.name: archiveDate
optional_parameters.description: date must be in format YYYYMMDD

api_list.name: Get General Game Information
api_list.description:
This returns very basic information about each game.  The some data points that you will get from this call which you won't get from other calls are the time that the game starts, the game ID and website reference links, and the game status (Postponed/scheduled/completed/in-progress/etc).  All game start times are in Eastern time zone.  

Example:

/getNHLGameInfo?gameID=20240413_DET@TOR

api_list.name: Get Box Score - Live - Real Time
api_list.description:
Retrieves the entire box score for a game either in progress or already completed.  The stats retrieved here are what are normally shown in box scores or used in fantasy games.  If there are any stats not here that you'd like to see, we can add them.  

The call looks like this /getNHLBoxScore?gameID=20240308_DET@ARI

The call needs to be exactly in the same format as above.  8 digit date, underscore, then the away team abbreviation, @, then home team abbreviation.  Complete list of team abbreviations can be retrieved with the getNHLTeams call or various other calls.  

But, the best way to find specific game ID's are either from the "getNHLGamesForDate" call, or the "getNHLTeamSchedule" call.

api_list.name: Get Daily Scoreboard - Live - Real Time
api_list.description:
Use this if you want basic game data returned.  It's lighter/quicker than getting the full boxscore, for applications that do not need anything but basic data like line score, away/home, etc.

/getNHLScoresOnly

This can be called using ?gameDate (returns all games for a date, format YYYYMMDD)  or ?gameID (returns one game, format YYYYMMDD_AWAY@HOME)

Also can be called with topPerformers=true to get a list of stat leaders in each category, per team.

optional_parameters.name: topPerformers
optional_parameters.description:
if you want to also return the top player in each major stat, set this to
true

optional_parameters.name: gameDate
optional_parameters.description: gameDate must be in the format YYYYMMDD

optional_parameters.name: gameID
optional_parameters.description: gameID can be found in many of the different endpoints.

api_list.name: Top News and Headlines
api_list.description:
This endpoint will retrieve relevant news links.
/getNHLNews

Options:
- playerID=xxx  
Enter a playerID here and get news for that player

- topNews=true  
Retrieves top news

- fantasyNews=true  
Retrieves top fantasy-relevant news 

- recentNews=true  
Retrieves most recent news, whether it's really fantasy relevant or not

- maxItems=xx  
Enter a number there to limit the number of responses you'll receive back.

All news will have a "link" and "title" element. Some will have "image" and some will have playerID (single item) or playerIDs (list).

optional_parameters.name: playerID
optional_parameters.description: playerID as can be found in many of the endpoints

api_list.name: Get Daily Schedule
api_list.description:
Get basic information on which games are being played during a day.

Example call: 

/getNHLGamesForDate?gameDate=20240101

The above call will return all of the games from January 1st, 2024.  Date must be in the format YYYYMMDD.

optional_parameters.name: gameDate
optional_parameters.description: Date must be in format YYYYMMDD

api_list.name: Get Player List
api_list.description: One call grabs the FULL NHL player list. This is mainly used for associating players with their "playerID" which is what you'll want to use when cross referencing with box scores.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://tank01-nhl-live-in-game-real-time-statistics-nhl.p.rapidapi.com/getNHLPlayerList"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tank01-nhl-live-in-game-real-time-statistics-nhl.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://tank01-nhl-live-in-game-real-time-statistics-nhl.p.rapidapi.com/getNHLPlayerList"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tank01-nhl-live-in-game-real-time-statistics-nhl.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
